intro: Microcoelum weddellianum, commonly known as the Weddell's microcoelum, is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, star-shaped flowers that are often yellow or orange in color. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
